meanings.definition: The skill or ability to perform or present oneself in an entertaining or impressive manner.
meanings.sent1: Her showmanship on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The magician's showmanship made the tricks even more exciting.
meanings.sent3: His showmanship was so good that he could make even the simplest act seem extraordinary.
meanings.sent4: The showmanship of the acrobat was like a master painter creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The showmanship of the singer left a lasting impression on everyone who watched.

meanings.definition: The quality of being a showman or showwoman.
meanings.sent1: The circus performer's showmanship was unmatched.
meanings.sent2: His showmanship as a ringmaster made the entire show more enjoyable.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's showmanship added an extra layer of humor to the performance.
meanings.sent4: Her showmanship was like a beacon, drawing the audience's attention effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The showmanship of the actor brought life to the character in a remarkable way.
